Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Small vase in blue-green faience
Description: This small vase in blue-green faience was part of a funerary collection from the pyramid of the king Nastasen. His tomb also contained an offering table in granite, a golden cylinder and some bronze mirrors decorated with cartouches of silver. Nastasen reigned during the second half of the fourth century BC.
